CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: From the onset oxidation potentials ( E onset ox ) and the onset reduction potentials ( E onset red ) of the polymers , the HOMO and LUMO energy levels as well as the energy gap of the polymers were calculated using a ferrocene / ferrocenium ( Fc / Fc + ) redox couple ( 4.80 eV below the vacuum level ) as an external standard.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| polymers |
| ferrocene / ferrocenium (Fc / Fc +) |

Explanation:

1. "polymers" - This is a material name as it refers to a class of chemical compounds consisting of large molecules made up of repeating subunits.
2. "ferrocene / ferrocenium (Fc / Fc +)" - This is also a material name, which refers to a type of organometallic compound used as an external standard in the calculation of energy levels of other polymers.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| polymers |
| ferrocene / ferrocenium (Fc / Fc +) |

Explanation:

1. "polymers" - This is a clear reference to a class of chemical compounds and is a material name.
2. "ferrocene / ferrocenium (Fc / Fc +)" - This is a specific type of organometallic compound and is a material name.

The other entities in the paragraph, such as "onset oxidation potentials", "onset reduction potentials", "HOMO and LUMO energy levels", "energy gap", and "vacuum level" do not clearly refer to material names and are therefore not included in the table.
